Full Review

Merrill Edge appeals to casual traders with a powerful combination of strong customer service and competitive pricing. The online broker integrates seamlessly with parent company Bank of America: Customers can access accounts at both with a single login, and Merrill Edge brokerage clients have access to investment advice at more than 2,100 Bank of America locations. Those who meet minimum balance requirements qualify for a limited number of commission-free trades each month.

Merrill Edge is best for:

  • Investors who value customer service
  • Bank of America customers
  • High-balance customers
  • Penny stock traders

Merrill Edge at a glance:

Name Rating Comments
Overall 4.9 Winner of NerdWallet's award for best broker for research.
Account Minimum 3.2 $0
Stock Trading Costs 4.0 None, other than promotions detailed elsewhere in table.
Commision free ETFs 4.0 $6.95. Customers who maintain a three-month average combined balance of $50,000+ in Bank of America and Merrill Edge accounts can qualify for up to 30 commission-free trades per month (100 free trades with $100,000+).
Customer Support Options 5.0 Phone support 24/7; live chat and email support. Investors can meet with a Merrill Edge Financial Solutions Advisor at over 2,100 Bank of America locations.
